<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D142165D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	CHINA UNICOM (HONG KONG) LIMITED
</B>
</P>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<A NAME="D142165D20F_HTM_FIN142165_7">
</A>
	NOTES TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(All amounts in RMB millions unless otherwise stated)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	ORGANIZATION AND PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	China Unicom (Hong Kong) Limited (the
	&#147;Company&#148;) was incorporated as a limited liability company in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (&#147;Hong Kong&#148;), the People&#146;s Republic of China (the &#147;PRC&#148;) on February 8, 2000. The principal activity of the
	Company is investment holding. The principal activities of the Company&#146;s subsidiaries are the provision of cellular and fixed-line voice and related value-added services, broadband and other Internet-related services, information communications
	technology services, and business and data communications services in the PRC. The GSM cellular voice, WCDMA cellular voice, LTE FDD cellular voice, TD-LTE cellular voice and related value-added services are referred to as the &#147;mobile
	service&#148;. The services aforementioned other than the mobile service are hereinafter collectively referred to as the &#147;fixed-line service&#148;. The Company and its subsidiaries are hereinafter referred to as the &#147;Group&#148;. The
	address of the Company&#146;s registered office is 75th Floor, The Center, 99 Queen&#146;s Road Central, Hong Kong.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The shares of the
	Company were listed on The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong Limited (&#147;SEHK&#148;) on June 22, 2000 and the American Depositary Shares (&#147;ADS&#148;) of the Company were listed on the New York Stock Exchange on June 21, 2000.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The substantial shareholders of the Company are China Unicom (BVI) Limited (&#147;Unicom BVI&#148;) and China Unicom Group Corporation (BVI)
	Limited (&#147;Unicom Group BVI&#148;). The majority of equity interests in Unicom BVI is owned by China United Network Communications Limited (&#147;A Share Company&#148;, a joint stock company incorporated in the PRC on December 31, 2001, with its
	A shares listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange on October 9, 2002). The majority of the equity interest in A Share Company is owned by China United Network Communications Group Company Limited (a state-owned enterprise established in the PRC,
	hereinafter referred to as &#147;Unicom Group&#148;). Unicom Group BVI is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Unicom Group. As a result, the directors of the Company consider Unicom Group to be the ultimate holding company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-13
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage128"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D142165D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	ORGANIZATION AND PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES (CONTINUED)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Disposal of Telecommunications Towers and Related Assets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On July 11, 2014, the Company (through China United Network Communications Corporation Limited (&#147;CUCL&#148;, a wholly-owned subsidiary of
	the Company)) entered into an agreement with China Mobile Communications Company Limited and its related subsidiaries (&#147;China Mobile&#148;) and China Telecom Corporation Limited (&#147;China Telecom&#148;) to establish China Tower Corporation
	Limited (&#147;Tower Company&#148;). Pursuant to the agreement, the Company subscribed for 3.01 billion shares at a par value of RMB1.00 per share in the registered capital of Tower Company in cash, representing 30.1% of the registered capital of
	Tower Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On October 14, 2015, CUCL and Unicom New Horizon Telecommunications Company Limited (&#147;Unicom New Horizon&#148;, a
	wholly-owned subsidiary of CUCL and an indirectly wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company) entered into a transfer agreement (the &#147;Transfer Agreement&#148;), amongst China Mobile, China Telecom, China Reform Holdings Corporation Limited
	(&#147;CRHC&#148;), and Tower Company. Pursuant to the Transfer Agreement, the Group, China Mobile and China Telecom will sell certain of their telecommunications towers and related assets (the &#147;Tower Assets&#148;) to Tower Company (hereinafter
	referred to as the &#147;Tower Assets Disposal&#148;) in exchange for shares issued by Tower Company and cash consideration. In addition, CRHC will make a cash subscription for shares of Tower Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Tower Assets Disposal was completed on October 31, 2015 (&#147;Completion Date&#148;). The final consideration amount for the Tower Assets
	Disposal attributed to the Group was determined as RMB54,658 million. Tower Company issued 33,335,836,822 shares (&#147;Consideration Shares&#148;) to CUCL at an issue price of RMB1.00 per share and the balance of the consideration of approximately
	RMB21,322 million payable in cash (&#147;Cash Consideration&#148;). The first tranche of the Cash Consideration of RMB3,000 million payable by Tower Company was settled in February 2016. The remaining balance of the Cash Consideration is to be
	settled before December 31, 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upon the issuance of new shares by Tower Company, the Group, China Mobile, China Telecom and CRHC own
	28.1%, 38.0%, 27.9% and 6.0% of Tower Company respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-14
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage129"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The principal accounting policies applied in the preparation
	of these consolidated financial statements are set out below. These policies have been consistently applied to all the years presented, unless otherwise stated.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Statement of Compliance
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The financial statements have been prepared in accordance with all
	applicable International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRSs&#148;) issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (&#147;IASB&#148;), which collective term includes all applicable individual International Financial Reporting
	Standards, International Accounting Standards (&#147;IASs&#148;) and Interpretations issued by the IASB. These consolidated financial statements have been authorized for issue by the company&#146;s board of directors on March 16, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Basis of Preparation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The consolidated financial statements have been prepared under the
	historical cost convention, as modified by the revaluation of financial assets at fair value through other comprehensive income. The consolidated financial statements prepared by the PRC subsidiaries for PRC statutory reporting purposes are based on
	the Chinese Accounting Standards for Business Enterprises (&#147;CAS&#148;) issued by the Ministry of Finance (&#147;MOF&#148;) of the PRC, which became effective from January 1, 2007 with certain transitional provisions. There are certain
	differences between the Group&#146;s IFRSs financial statements and PRC financial statements. The principal adjustments made to the PRC financial statements to conform to IFRSs include the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	reversal of the revaluation surplus or deficit and related amortization charges arising from the revaluation of prepayments for the leasehold land performed by independent valuers for the purpose of reporting to
	relevant PRC government authorities;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	recognition of goodwill associated with the acquisition of certain subsidiaries prior to 2005;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	additional capitalization of borrowing costs and corresponding impact on depreciation prior to the adoption of CAS on January 1, 2007; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	adjustments for deferred taxation in relation to the above adjustments.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-15

<A NAME="eolPage130"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">

	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

	SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (CONTINUED)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	2.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Basis of Preparation (Continued)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Disposal of Telecommunications Towers and Related Assets
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As stated in Note 1, on October 31,
	2015, CUCL and Unicom New Horizon completed the Group&#146;s Tower Assets Disposal with a total consideration of approximately RMB54,658 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Tower Assets Disposal was accounted as an assets disposal. Since the Company owned 28.1% of the share capital of Tower Company, only 71.9%
	of the gain on the Group&#146;s Tower Assets Disposal was recognized for the year ended December 31, 2015 with the remaining 28.1% of the aforesaid gain deferred over the remaining useful life of the Tower Assets related to the Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The details of the Tower Assets related to the Group as at the Completion Date and the gain on the Group&#146;s Tower Assets Disposal were as
	follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Going Concern Assumption
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December 31, 2015, current liabilities of the Group exceeded
	current assets by approximately RMB279.4 billion (2014: approximately RMB235.3 billion). Given the current global economic conditions and the Group&#146;s expected capital expenditure in the foreseeable future, management has comprehensively
	considered the Group&#146;s available sources of funds as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Group&#146;s continuous net cash inflows from operating activities;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Approximately RMB346.4 billion of revolving banking facilities and registered quota of commercial papers, promissory notes and corporate bonds, of which approximately RMB227.2 billion was unutilized as of December 31,
	2015; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Other available sources of financing from domestic banks and other financial institutions given the Group&#146;s credit history.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, the Group believes it has the ability to raise funds from the short, medium and long-term perspectives and maintain reasonable
	financing costs through appropriate financing portfolio.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-16
</P>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>

</B>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Basis of Preparation (Continued)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Going Concern Assumption (Continued)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the above considerations, the Board of Directors is of the opinion that the Group
	has sufficient funds to meet its working capital requirements and debt obligations. As a result, the consolidated financial statements of the Group for the year ended December 31, 2015 have been prepared on a going concern basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Critical Accounting Estimates and Judgements
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The preparation of the consolidated financial
	statements in conformity with IFRSs requires management to make judgements, estimates and assumptions that affect the application of policies and reported amounts of assets, liabilities, income and expenses. The estimates and associated assumptions
	are based on historical experience and various other factors that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis of making the judgements about carrying values of assets and liabilities that are not
	readily apparent from other sources. Actual results may differ from these estimates.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The estimates and underlying assumptions are
	reviewed on an ongoing basis. Revisions to accounting estimates are recognized in the period in which the estimate is revised if the revision affects only that period, or in the period of the revision and future periods if the revision affects both
	current and future periods.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Judgements made by management in the application of IFRSs that have significant effect on the financial
	statements and major sources of estimation uncertainty are discussed in Note 4.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-17
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage132"></A>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (CONTINUED)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Basis of Preparation (Continued)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	New Accounting Standards and Amendments
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The following amendments to standards are mandatory for the first time for the financial year beginning January 1, 2015 and are applicable to the Group:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="24%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Amendments to IAS 19, &#147;Defined benefit plans: Employee Contributions&#148;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:28%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	amendments introduce a relief to reduce the complexity of accounting for certain contributions from employees or third parties under defined benefit plans. When the contributions are eligible for the practical expedient provided by the amendments, a
	company is allowed to recognize the contributions as a reduction of the service cost in the period in which the related service is rendered, instead of including them in calculating the defined benefit obligation. The amendments do not have an
	impact on these financial statements as the defined benefit plans operated by the Group are wholly funded by contributions from the Group and do not involve contributions from employees or third parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="24%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Annual Improvements to IFRSs 2010-2012 Cycle and 2011-2013 Cycle
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:28%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	These two cycles of annual
	improvements contain amendments to nine standards with consequential amendments to other standards. Among them, IAS 24, &#147;Related party disclosures&#148; has been amended to expand the definition of a &#147;related party&#148; to include a
	management entity that provides key management personnel services to the reporting entity, and to require the disclosure of the amounts incurred for obtaining the key management personnel services provided by the management entity. These amendments
	do not have an impact on the Group&#146;s related party disclosures as the Group does not obtain key management personnel services from management entities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-18
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage133"></A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:24%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group will adopt the relevant amendments and new standards in the subsequent periods as required. The
	Group is in the process of making an assessment of what the impact of these amendments and new standards are expected to be in the period of initial application.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	F-19
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage134"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D142165D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (CONTINUED)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Consolidation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The consolidated financial statements include the financial statements of the
	Company and all of its subsidiaries made up to December 31.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Subsidiaries are entities controlled by the Group. The Group controls an
	entity when it is exposed, or has rights to variable returns from its involvement with the entity and has the ability to affect those returns through its power over the entity. When assessing whether the Group has power, only substantive rights
	(held by the Group and other parties) are considered.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Subsidiaries are fully consolidated from the date on which control is transferred
	to the Group. When the Group ceases to have control, any retained interest in the entity is re-measured to its fair value at the date when control is lost, with the change in carrying amount recognized in the statement of income. The fair value is
	the initial carrying amount for the purposes of subsequently accounting for the retained interest as an associate, joint venture or financial asset. In addition, any amounts previously recognized in other comprehensive income in respect of that
	entity are accounted for as if the Group had directly disposed of the related assets or liabilities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group adopted the purchase
	method of accounting to account for business combination of entities and businesses under common control before 2005. Under the purchase method of accounting in force at the date of the acquisition, the cost of an acquisition was measured at the
	fair value of the assets given, equity instruments issued and liabilities incurred or assumed at the date of exchange, plus costs directly attributable to the acquisition. Identifiable assets acquired and liabilities and contingent liabilities
	assumed were measured initially at their fair values at the acquisition date, irrespective of the extent of any non-controlling interest. The excess of the cost of acquisition over the fair value of the Group&#146;s share of the identifiable net
	assets acquired was recorded as goodwill. If the cost of acquisition was less than the fair value of the Group&#146;s share of the identifiable net assets of the subsidiary acquired, the difference was recognized directly in the statement of income.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Business combination of entity and business under common control of the Group after 2005 was accounted for using merger accounting. Upon
	the adoption of IFRSs by the Group in 2008, the Group adopted the accounting policy to account for business combinations of entities and businesses under common control using the predecessor values method.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Inter-company transactions, balances and unrealized gains on transactions between group companies are eliminated. Unrealized losses are also
	eliminated unless the transaction provides evidence of an impairment of the asset transferred. Accounting policies of subsidiaries would be changed where necessary in the consolidated financial statements to ensure consistency with the policies
	adopted by the Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-20
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage135"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D142165D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (CONTINUED)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Associates and joint ventures
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An associate is an entity in which the Group has significant
	influence, but not control or joint control, over its management, including participation in the financial and operating policy decisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A joint venture is an arrangement whereby the Group and other parties contractually agree to share control of the arrangement, and have rights
	to the net assets of the arrangement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An investment in an associate or a joint venture is accounted for in the consolidated financial
	statements under the equity method, unless it is classified as held for sale (or included in a disposal group that is classified as held for sale). Under the equity method, the investment is initially recorded at cost, adjusted for any excess of the
	Group&#146;s share of the acquisition-date fair values of the investee&#146;s identifiable net assets over the cost of the investment (if any). Thereafter, the investment is adjusted for the post acquisition change in the Group&#146;s share of the
	investee&#146;s net assets and any impairment loss relating to the investment. The Group&#146;s share of the post-acquisition post-tax results of the investees and any impairment losses for the year are recognized in the consolidated statement of
	income, whereas the Group&#146;s share of the post-acquisition post-tax items of the investees&#146; other comprehensive income is recognized as other comprehensive income in the consolidated statement of comprehensive income.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	When the Group&#146;s share of losses exceeds its interest in the associate or the joint venture, the Group&#146;s interest is reduced to nil
	and recognition of further losses is discontinued except to the extent that the Group has incurred legal or constructive obligations or made payments on behalf of the investee. For this purpose, the Group&#146;s interest is the carrying amount of
	the investment under the equity method together with the Group&#146;s long-term interests that in substance form part of the Group&#146;s net investment in the associate or the joint venture.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Unrealized profits and losses resulting from transactions between the Group and its associates and joint venture are eliminated to the extent
	of the Group&#146;s interest in the investee, except where unrealized losses provide evidence of an impairment of the asset transferred, in which case they are recognized immediately in profit or loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If an investment in an associate becomes an investment in a joint venture or vice versa, retained interest is not remeasured. Instead, the
	investment continues to be accounted for under the equity method.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In all other cases, when the Group ceases to have significant influence
	over an associate or joint control over a joint venture, it is accounted for as a disposal of the entire interest in that investee, with a resulting gain or loss being recognized in profit or loss. Any interest retained in that former investee at
	the date when significant influence or joint control is lost is recognized at fair value and this amount is regarded as the fair value on initial recognition of a financial asset.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-21
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage136"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D142165D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (CONTINUED)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.5
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Segment Reporting
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:10%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Operating segments are reported in a manner consistent with the internal
	reporting provided to the Chief Operating Decision Maker (&#147;CODM&#148;). The CODM, who is responsible for allocating resources and assessing performance of the operating segments regularly, has been identified as the Executive Directors of the
	Company that makes strategic decisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.6
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Foreign Currency Translation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Functional and presentation currency
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Items included in the financial statements of each of
	the Group&#146;s entities are measured using the currency of the primary economic environment in which the entities operate (&#147;the functional currency&#148;). The consolidated financial statements are presented in RMB, which is the
	Company&#146;s functional and presentation currency.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Transactions and balances
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Foreign currency transactions are translated into the functional
	currency using the exchange rates prevailing at the dates of the transactions or valuation where items are re-measured. Foreign exchange gains and losses resulting from the settlement of such transactions and from the translation at year-end
	exchange rates of monetary assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies are recognized in the statement of income.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Group companies
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The results and financial position of all the Group entities (none of which
	has the currency of a hyperinflationary economy) that have a functional currency different from the presentation currency are translated into the presentation currency as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Assets and liabilities for each statement of financial position presented are translated at the closing rate at the statement of financial position date;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Income and expenses for each statement of income are translated at average exchange rates (unless this average is not a reasonable approximation of the cumulative effect of the rates prevailing on the transaction dates,
	in which case income and expenses are translated at the dates of the transactions); and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	All resulting exchange differences are recognized in other comprehensive income and as a separate component of equity into other reserve.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On consolidation, exchange differences arising from the translation of the net investment in foreign operations, and of borrowings and other
	currency instruments designated as hedges of such investments, are taken to shareholders&#146; equity. When a foreign operation is sold, such exchange differences are recognized in the statement of income as part of the gain or loss on disposal.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-22
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage137"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D142165D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (CONTINUED)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.6
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Foreign Currency Translation (Continued)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Group companies(Continued)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the convenience of the reader, the translation of RMB into United States dollars
	(&#147;US$&#148;) has been made at the rate of RMB6.4778 to US$1.00, representing the rate as certified by the H.10 weekly statistical release of Federal Reserve Board on December 31, 2015. No representation is made that RMB amounts could have been,
	or could be, converted into US$ at that rate or at any other certain rate on December 31, 2015 or at any other date. The US$ convenience translation is not required under IFRS and all US$ convenience translation amounts in the accompanying
	consolidated financial statements are unaudited.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.7
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Property, Plant and Equipment
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Construction-in-progress
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Construction-in-progress (&#147;CIP&#148;) represents buildings,
	plant and equipment under construction and pending installation, and is stated at cost less accumulated impairment losses. Costs include construction and acquisition costs, and interest charges arising from borrowings used to finance the assets
	during the construction period. No provision for depreciation is made on CIP until such time as the assets are completed and ready for its intended use. When the asset being constructed becomes available for use, the CIP is transferred to the
	appropriate category of assets.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Property, plant and equipment
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Property, plant and equipment held by the Group are stated at
	cost less accumulated depreciation and accumulated impairment losses, and are depreciated over their expected useful lives.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Property,
	plant and equipment comprise buildings, telecommunications equipment, leasehold improvements, office furniture, fixtures, motor vehicles and other equipment. The cost of an asset, except for those acquired in exchange for a non-monetary asset or
	assets, comprises its purchase price and any directly attributable costs of bringing the asset to its working condition and location for its intended use.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If an item of property, plant and equipment is acquired in exchange for another item of property, plant and equipment, the cost of such an
	item of property, plant and equipment is measured at fair value unless (i) the exchange transactions lacks commercial substance or (ii) the fair value of neither the asset received nor the asset given up is reliably measurable. If the acquired item
	is not measured at fair value, its cost is measured at the carrying amount of the asset given up.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Subsequent costs are included in the
	asset&#146;s carrying amount or recognized as a separate asset, as appropriate, only when it is probable at the time the costs are incurred that future economic benefits associated with the item will flow to the Group, and the cost of the item can
	be measured reliably. The carrying amount of the replaced part is derecognized. All other repairs and maintenance are charged to the statement of income during the financial period in which they are incurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-23
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage138"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

</B>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.7
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Property, Plant and Equipment (Continued)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Depreciation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:17%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Depreciation on property, plant and equipment is calculated using the
	straight-line method to allocate their costs less their residual values over their estimated useful lives, as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_50"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="68%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="70%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="8%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="8%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="2" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00PT SOLID #000000">
	Depreciable&nbsp;life
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>

	Residual&nbsp;rate
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Buildings
</P>
</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>

</TD>

</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Telecommunications equipment
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">

</TD>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>

	3-5
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Office furniture, fixtures, motor vehicles and other equipment
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>
